intro: Cheiranthus integrifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has simple, entire leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. Cheiranthus integrifolius is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
